title: Customer requests this font - Unknown?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701130457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/10436174_837506396276945_1969661896690271285_n_5619.jpg)

Thank you for your help, in advance!
author: ldpx

comments.content:
This is an old wood type called Painters Roman.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701130457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Painters-Roman_6613.jpg)
 It was first produced in the late 1870s by Vanderburgh and Wells and by the William Page Wood Type Co. Here is the character set of a condensed version, in the form of a mirrored photograph of the actual wood type.
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701130457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PaintersRomanWoodTypeMirrorSM_6728.jpg)
  
I don't recall a digital version, but will check further.  
Don

Found a digital version. Juniper by Joy Redick for Adobe [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/juniper/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701130457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/juniper/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/juniper/")  
Your image may have been made from Juniper, with the width expanded somewhat.  
Don
Thank you kindly, donshottype! Your knowledge is most appreciated. :)
